author: JamesWTruher
body:
Use the latest version of Pester from the Gallery to invoke our tests. A number of test changes needed to be made because some assertions were dropped in the 4x version of Pester.
I have left the Restore-PSPester function in the case that someone would like to have the older version. This can certainly be removed if desired.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
Maintainers: please make sure this passes `[feature]` tests before merging.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: as @markekraus, can you please work with one of the maintainers to run your tests with feature in the CI system.

comments.author: stknohg
comments.body:
Why don’t we adopt Pester 4.0 new assertion syntax?

e.g.

```powershell
# current syntax
$var1 | Should Not Be 10

# Pester 4.0 new assertion syntax
$var1 | Should -Not -Be 10
```

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @stknohg My preference would be to make the change to the new assertion syntax in separate PR's, one per test file, after we have successfully moved the tests to work with 4.0. It's one thing to make the tests work with 4.0, it is an entirely other thing to switch to the new syntax. switching all tests to the new syntax in this PR would make it hard to see what changes were necessary just to get it working with 4.0.
